TopicTitle: On Monday February 2 2015 the US president releases his budget request for 2016.

The projected cost for new frontiers looks high, is that Europa-Clipper? Sad to see Opportunity dropped.

The projected cost for new frontiers looks high, is that Europa-Clipper? Sad to see Opportunity dropped.

Europe clipper would be flagship. They had a competition for EC proposals in the New Frontiers class, but none of them offered the kind of science return required by the decadal survey.

Europe clipper would be flagship. They had a competition for EC proposals in the New Frontiers class, but none of them offered the kind of science return required by the decadal survey.

Europa looks like a separately funded thing now, with a solar-powered, multiple-flyby (Jupiter orbiter) mission already slated to beginning planning this year. It doesn't appear to be a New Frontiers proposal, but it's not funded at the level of a flagship. New Frontiers seems to be headed toward program selection in 2017 and then another in 2022. Looks like current proposals under consideration include Venus In Situ Explorer, Saturn Probe, Trojan Tour and Rendezvous, the Comet Surface Sample Return, and Lunar South Pole-Aitken Basin Sample Return.

Sad to see Opportunity dropped.

I don't think neither LRO nor Opportunity will be dismissed. This is exactly what happened last year, but Congress urged to save them. Sure, Americans need to advocate a bit, but I'm pretty confident those two missions will keep going.

The one constant in human nature when it comes to government funding:

Everybody agrees that the budget is a calamity waiting to happen. Everybody agrees that it needs fixed. Everybody agrees that their own personal favorite programs should have more funding, while everything they dislike should get cuts.

And nobody can agree on which programs are which.

It doesn't work that way. For everyone who thinks NASA is worthy and the military needs slashed, there's someone else who thinks the opposite. Therefore no solution and the problem gets worse every year.

Eventually (sooner rather than later) the government will be broke and nothing will get funded.

Best,

-Slashy
